bibl.title: Dispatch from Hilary R. W. Johnson to Leopold II

correspAction.persName: Léopold II, King of the Belgians, 1835-1909

div1.p: To His Majesty Léopold II Very Dear and Great Friend,

The letter which you did me the kindness to address to me, announcing your assumption by authority of the Legislative Chamber of Belgium, of the title of personal Sovereign of the Independant State of the Congo, not only awakened a lively feeling of pleasure, but it announced a step anticipated by the judgement of the entire world, considering the long, ardent and unselfish devotion of Your Majesty to the regeneration of Africa.-

in order that I may in some way assist in facilitating the task which Your Majesty has set before You, I shall as soon as practicable, accredit near Your Majesty's Government of the Free State of the Congo, a representative who shall on all occasions, assure Your Majesty of my deep sympathy and ardent desire for the prosperity of Your Government.
I beg to renew to Your Majesty the assurance of my highest esteem and of the inviolable friendship with which I am,
Very dear and great Friend, Your sincere Friend, H. Johnson.
By the President E. J. Barclay.- Secretary of State.-
